content: just put the finished base in your bag but as you might know i never miss an opportunity to add buttons to my projects … i sewed this lovely big button right through the bottom of the bag and through the middle of the plastic circle a few times so my base is firmly held in place that s the small bag finished now for a couple of variations the next bag i knitted followed the same pattern but this time i used a yarn with a much shorter colour run this is the discontinued stylecraft batik elements 138 m / 50g in magnesium where the colours change every 15 - 20 cm / 6 - 8 this gives a mottled almost woven look rather than the stripes of the first yarn oh look another button 8 big knot bag i wanted to try knitting a version of of the basic bag that would be big enough to hold a sock knitting project and this was the result again i used a variegated dk weight yarn this time stylecraft batik swirl 500 m / 200g shade 3732 blue ocean this yarn has the longest colour run of the three yarns i used i didn t measure the lengths of colour but as you can see from the photos you get very big distinct stripes of colour the finished bag has a 15 cm / 6 diameter base and is 23 cm / 9 tall not counting the handles i saw that plain stripe in the middle of the bag as an opportunity to add some more buttons the bigger bag is knitted in much the same way as the small one it s just a bit … well bigger the base work the first 16 rounds of the original pattern and then add another ten rounds round 18 kf&b k9 x 8 88 sts round 20 kf&b k10 x 8 96 sts round 22 kf&b k11 x 8 104 sts round 24 kf&b k12 x 8 112 sts round 26 kf&b k13 x 8 120 sts 9 the body of the bag increase one stitch on the next round giving you 121 stitches and then change to a 6 5 mm needle and follow the same two round pattern as before for the body of the bag round 1 k1 *sl 1 pwise wyif k1 repeat from * to end round 2 sl 1 pwise wyif *k1 sl 1 pwise wyif repeat from * to end i worked 90 rounds this time a length of about 23 cm / 9 the short handle again the handles are worked the same as those on the small bag just with more repeats as the handles are a bit wider row 1 sl 1pwise wyif k1 x 12 turn 24 sts row 2 p2tog sl 1 pwise wyib p1 x 11 23 sts row 3 sl 1 pwise wyif k1 x 10 sl 1 pwise wyib k2tog 22 sts row 4 sl 1
